text.p: -- Credit Suisse First Boston said on Tuesday it had raised its rating for Chilean bottler Embotelladora Andina SA to buy from hold.

-- "Andina reported better-than-expected fourth quarter earnings of $0.56 per ADS (American Depositary Share), versus our expectation of $0.50 and $0.47 in the comparable 1995 quarter, driven by double-digit unit growth in Chile and Argentina and a recovery of margins in Brazil," the bank said in a report.
-- Credit Suisse First Boston raised its 1997 target price to $46 from $37.
-- The bank raised its estimate for 1997 earnings per share to $1.80 from $1.70 and set a 1998 estimate for earnings per share of $2.20.
-- The company's ADSs closed on Monday at 36-1/2.
